channel.title: FlowLayout Vertical Gap
channel.description:
Is there a way to temporarily change the vertical gap between two lines in a FlowLayout? I've got two lines that I want closer to each other than the rest. Example: [code]line of text (original)
line of text (original)
line of text (closer) line of text (closer)
line of text (original)[/code] Setting the layout's vertical gap before the add and then changing it back to the default after adding the component does not work. I.E. [code]layout.setVgap(5); ... layout.setVgap(15);[/code] I understand why this doesn't work ^
Any ideas how this could be done? Or is it not a good idea with a FlowLayout? I've restricted resizing and maximizing the internal frame, so I know that the window will never change it's size.
Anyways, thanks for any help or opinions. Adam
[b]EDIT:[/b] I understand the concept of a FlowLayout and why this functionality may not work. I'm pretty much trying to specify at a certain line to change the gap, yet with FlowLayout, technically we don't know how many lines we would have because the user could resize the window; however, in my situation I do know how many lines there would be.

item.title: FlowLayout Vertical Gap
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Add the middle two to their own Panel, where it can have a separate layout with a different vertical gap. AFAIK its the only way using FlowLayout.

You could also use a SpringLayout. You set component positions relative to other components, but it is rather annoying to try and do this by hand for large scale GUIs.
